title: The string module
content:
If you want the list of every letter, just do

```python
import string
print(string.ascii_uppercase)
```

title: Save a logged object to a variable
content:
In the Chrome Dev Tool, right click on a console.loged object, and click on `Store as global variable`. The *actual* object is saved `temp1`, you can now access it as is!

A stupid example:

```javascript
> const obj = {a: 'b'}
undefined
> console.log(obj)
{a: "b"}
> // right click on the object and select Store as global variable`
undefined
> temp1
{a: "b"}
> temp1.c = 'd'
"d"
> temp1
{a: "b", c: "d"}
> obj
{a: "b", c: "d"}
```

Pretty cool, right?

Note: if you want to do the same with DOM objects, you have to `console.dir`
them.
